Sourav Ganguly Wore His Team India Blazer While Taking Charge As BCCI President Which Is Bound To Make You Nostalgic

Sourav Ganguly Wore His Team India Blazer While Taking Charge As BCCI President Which Is Bound To Make You Nostalgic

Once he took charge as the president of the BCCI, Sourav Ganguly wore his Team India blazer which he got after becoming captain in 2000.

"I got it when I was the captain of India. So, I decided I would wear it but I did not realise that it is so loose," Ganguly said at the press conference.

He is the 39th president of BCCI.

afp

For him it's a honour and hopes to do what is best for the board.

"It is an honour that I have been asked to take this role by the members when it is a new start for the BCCI. Fortunately or unfortunately, even when I became the captain, it was a similar sort of a situation," he said.

"From that point of view, I find myself very fortunate to be in a position where I can make a change. I will do it the way I know. I will do it in a way which I feel is the best for the BCCI with no compromise on credibility, corruption-free and same for all BCCI," he added.

For those of us who grew up watching him play, seeing him in his Team India blazer brought back those old memories. One cannot help but feel a sense of nostalgia. Knowing Ganguly's nature, one can expect him to lead BCCI the same way he led India - from the front.

With Inputs From ANI.
